column4: I see lines beginning with @include in my pam.conf -- I understand include, but what's with the @?
felipe_, you could, but i don't think you'd want to.  there would be compatibility problems, i believe
hmm...so if I want to say, download a newer version of php than what's available in my repo, then I have to add a 3rd party PPA?
I mean you could try adding a repo for a version of ubuntu that isn't the one you have, but it seems like it'd be path to confusion and badness
